div.h1: Generation, implementation, and appraisal of an N-gram-based stemming algorithm

div.div: Bhagwati P Pande
Department of Computer Science, SSJ Campus, Kumaun University, Almora, Uttarakhand, India
Correspondence: Bhagwati P. Pande, Department of Computer Science, SSJ Campus, Kumaun University, Almora, Uttarakhand, 263601, India. E-mail:bp.pande@rediffmail.com
Search for other works by this author on:
Pawan Tamta
Government Post Graduate College, Manila, Almora, Uttarakhand, India

Hoshiyar S Dhami
Uttarakhand Residential University, Almora, Uttarakhand, India
Search for other works by this author on:

Published:
15 October 2018
Views

div.p: Bhagwati P Pande, Pawan Tamta, Hoshiyar S Dhami, Generation, implementation, and appraisal of an N-gram-based stemming algorithm, Digital Scholarship in the Humanities, Volume 34, Issue 3, September 2019, Pages 558–568, https://doi.org/10.1093/llc/fqy053

div.div: Share

optgroup.label: Search within this journal
optgroup.option: All Digital Scholarship in the Humanities

optgroup.label: Search within this journal
optgroup.option: All Digital Scholarship in the Humanities

section.p: A language-independent stemmer has always been looked for. Single N-gram tokenization technique works well; however, it often generates stems that start with intermediate characters, rather than initial ones. We present a novel technique that takes the concept of N-gram stemming one step ahead and compare our method with an established algorithm in the field, say, Porter’s stemmer for English, Spanish, and Portuguese languages. Results indicate that our N-gram stemmer is comparable with the Porter’s linguistic stemmer.
